item.title: Tree roots damaged, is tree safe?, 20th January
item.description:
The road surface was recently resurfaced and in the process, some of the roots of this large hornbeam were damaged/severed (on the road side of the tree). Its roots are also causing damage to the pavement. Although the tree had its crown reduced relatively recently it is now very large, close to my property and obscures daylight from the rooms at the front of my house. I am concerned particularly that it may have become unstable/unhealthy due to the recent damage to its roots and could now be a safety concern

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
